chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
x: list sig
G: cfg
y: list sig

Goal:
x <<= sym_G G -> rewt G x y -> y <<= sym_G G

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive rewt (S : cfg) (x : list sig) : list sig -> Prop := rewtRefl : rewt S x x | rewtRule : forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> rew_cfg S y z -> rewt S x z Arguments rewt _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments rewtRefl _ _%list_scope Arguments rewtRule _ (_ _ _)%list_scope
sym_G = fun G : cfg => startsym G :: flat_map (fun '(a, x) => a :: x) (rules G) : cfg -> list sig
L = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => rewt G [startsym G] x /\ terminal G x : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments L _ _%list_scope
CFP = fun G : cfg => exists x : list sig, L G x /\ x = rev x : cfg -> Prop
rules = fun G : cfg => snd G : cfg -> list rule
terminal = fun (G : cfg) (x : list sig) => ~ (exists y : list sig, rew_cfg G x y) : cfg -> list sig -> Prop Arguments terminal _ _%list_scope
rewtRule : forall (S : cfg) (x y z : list sig), rewt S x y -> rew_cfg S y z -> rewt S x z
rewt_sind : forall (S : cfg) (x : list sig) (P : list sig -> SProp), P x -> (forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> P y -> rew_cfg S y z -> P z) -> forall l : list sig, rewt S x l -> P l
rewt_ind : forall (S : cfg) (x : list sig) (P : list sig -> Prop), P x -> (forall y z : list sig, rewt S x y -> P y -> rew_cfg S y z -> P z) -> forall l : list sig, rewt S x l -> P l
startsym = fun G : cfg => fst G : cfg -> sig
itau2_app : forall A B : list sig, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- Type] ?P : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- stack ?X]
itau1_app : forall A B : list sig, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- Type] ?P : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- stack ?X]
terminal_iff : forall (G : cfg) (x : list sig), terminal G x < -> (forall (s : sig) (y : list sig), s el x -> ~ (s, y) el rules G)
nil_app_nil : forall A : list ?X, A = [] ++ A ++ [] where ?X : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- Type]
tau2_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B where ?X : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- Type]
tau1_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B where ?X : [x : list sig G : cfg y : list sig |- Type]
in_in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> x el l -> x el remove eq_dec y l
remove_incl : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l1 l2 : list A) (x : A), l1 <<= l2 -> remove eq_dec x l1 <<= remove eq_dec x l2
list_prefix_inv : forall (X : Type) (a : X) (x u y v : list X), ~ a el x -> ~ a el u -> x ++ a :: y = u ++ a :: v -> x = u /\ y = v
sigma_snoc : forall (A : CFP.stack sig) (x y u v : list sig) (s s' : sig), sigma s A = x ++ [s] ++ y -> ~ s el x -> ~ s el y -> sigma s' (A ++ [(u, v)]) = x ++ u ++ s' ++ v ++ y
sigma_inv : forall (A : CFP.stack sig) (s1 s : sig) (x y : list sig), sigma s1 A = x ++ [s] ++ y -> ~ s el x -> ~ s el y -> ~ s el sym A -> s1 = s
in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x el remove eq_dec y l -> x el l /\ x <> y
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
incl_lrcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
incl_rcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el map f l < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ x el l)
sym_map : forall (X : Type) (f : X -> card sig) (l : list X) (Sigma : list sig), (forall x : X, x el l -> sym [f x] <<= Sigma) -> sym (map f l) <<= Sigma
incl_shift : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= B -> x :: A <<= x :: B
filter_pq_mono : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> bool) (A : list X), (forall x : X, x el A -> p x = true -> q x = true) -> filter p A <<= filter q A
